data.title: Not as good as it used to be
data.text: Every since the museum was moved down town no one that lives in Owensboro likes it.  They brought none the good stuff from the old museum location. I miss the big train set antd the Python skin on the wall.

data.title: Mixed Feelings
data.text:
My kids (ages 10 and 14) weren't impressed with this museum. It had been years since we last visited and we were spending some free time while downtown. 

Sadly, there aren't many exhibits; nothing interesting whatsoever. I would think instead of our city getting more and more restaurants, we should focus on a better museum and more family friendly entertainment.

data.title: Too small and not much exhibits.
data.text: Not many exhibits for kids. Needs to be more kids stuff. For a small booming city of Owensboro you would expect a little better.

data.title: Discovery!
data.text: A very cool museum with everything from dinasaur exhibits, historical exhibits, to hands on fun exhibits. A great place for young and old alike. There is a really cool race car exhibit here with alot of actual race cars, motorcycles, and even a hydro boat.

data.title: Indoor playground
data.text: The indoor playground is pretty great for small children.  It's a nice place to play when the weather outside is no conducive to playing outside.  There is plenty of room to run, climb, and explore.  My two 4-year old sons love it!

data.title: Disappointing
data.text: We came to see a presentation about birds of prey. The presentation was long and boring and my kids tired of it quickly. What we saw of the rest of the museum was subpar. Most of the interactives didn't work, the train in the entry had buttons with labels missing and the layout was cobbled together and uninspiring. The second floor looks like a storage room and doesn't seem finished. The playground is OK. But that's not why I go to a museum. I don't understand why the city can afford a million dollar playground at Smothers Park but can't afford to bring it's science museum up to par.

data.title: Nice museum nice price
data.text: Went to this museum with my 2 year old. It has a good number of interactive exhibits for younger children. Price of admission is cheap. Took us about 90 miniutes to get thru it but we stopped at all the exhibits and spent a good amount of time at the water table. Cave exhibit was closed the day we went. Overall fun at a good price

data.title: Some exhibits closed/missing
data.text: Maybe it was between exhibits or an off season, but the tree house was gone, the wind machine was out of service, the coal mine tour was closed and only half the train table display worked. Some of the history exhibits seemed under construction. Only getting in free on a reciprocal membership and the very nice desk clerk kept it from being a poor (2 star) experience. Maybe we'll try again in the summer monthsand hopefully everything working our improved then.

data.title: Great for Kids and very reasonable….
data.text: It was only $3.00 and well worth it. The kids had a blast. Lots of interactive things science related. It was very updated but lots of neat basic stuff for kids.

data.title: Small museum
data.text: Not my favorite.  Years ago, before they moved downtown, the museum was great.  Now it just doesn't compare to big city museums.  Not a lot to see and do.

data.title: Our local Museum is pretty cool!
data.text: I have enjoyed the displays and hope we will see some new displays soon. I know there are many cool things in storage that we never get to see anymore. I would love to see a small corner display that highlights a cool artifact from our "vault". A new display each month would draw in more visits too.

data.title: Great place for children to enjoy various things
data.text: This museum in one of a kind, the museum director is great, especially with children during school & summer breaks.  They have an awesome New Year's Party during the day for children, they change the itinerary to keep it interesting for everyone. You will have to visit it to see for your self.  It's located in downtown Owensboro, close to hotels/restaurants, the river park, convention center, etc etc,

data.title: What a great asset for Owensboro, KY
data.text: The Science and History Museum in Owensboro is a fun place for children and adults. Take the adventure of the coal mine to see history come alive. Check out the events for children throughout the year.

data.title: Wonderful!!
data.text: My kids were skeptical about going at first but once we got to the 2nd floor I couldn't get them to leave!!! It was well worth the admission, which is EXTREMELY cheap!! If you have children & are looking for a cheap but fun time, I suggest going here. I also enjoyed looking around and reading some of the history so it's good for adults too. The best of both worlds if you ask me.

data.title: Lots of fun; exhibits need some updating
data.text: I love taking my children and their friends to the Owensboro Museum of Science and History. The Playzeum is excellent and gives children lots of options for play with the tree houses, large slide, tunnel over 2nd Street, replica train and riverboat. The hands on exhibits are well worn from hours of play through the years. There is a "coal mining" exhibit and a "cave" exhibit that can be explored at specific intervals, a large train model at the front entrance along with a fresh water aquarium all near the front register and gift shop. A lot of money has been put into the park downtown and some dollars need to be invested here to bring some of the exhibits up to par and liven up the space. The workers/volunteers are very friendly and they work wonders with the items they have available to display. All in all, a good value for your money and lots of fun for cold and rainy days.

data.title: So many disappointments
data.text: It seems we visited during a power outage debacle of sorts!  Staff was unfriendly and did not inform us of the power issues before we were obligates to pay. Half of the Museum was without power and more than half of the interactive exhibits, that may have been functional, did not work. There also seems to be a lack of upkeep and cleanliness.  The boys (7-11 years old) liked some of the playroom items on the second floor. We were given free vouchers to return when the power issues have been fixed, but we will not be returning.

data.title: A Bit of Local History….
data.text: Stop in for some history about the area.  It isn't the best museum as far as quantity of exhibits but is still a good option!  We enjoyed learning about Owensboro.

data.title: good indoor playroom for kids
data.text:
This is a small museum how ever this is a great rainy or cold day place to go for younger kids to run off energy.

they have slides trees to climb ect

data.title: The oddest range of subjects in a small museum we have ever seen!
data.text: We found this place by walking by, and seeing a train set in the window. The best $3 we spent that day! It was just so bizarre to see such a varied collection of items. First you walk through a brief section about baseball teams from the area and a Broadwaysinger from the 40's. Then a spotty political section, a wider section on the demise of the passenger pigeon, into a child's area for learning about nutrition?! A wagon from the Owensboro wagon company, several taxidermied critters, fire trucks and a few random machines from the past, a mastodon skeleton and lots of fish models, then a model of a small dinosaur. In the back of the place is a decent display of racing cars, bikes, a boat and soapbox derby cars. In the middle of the place is a replica of a small cave which takes about 5 minutes to check out but the guide was very informative. There is also a playroom upstairs for children and a cute little gift shop. We were baffled by the range of displays but had a lot of fun marveling over how unconnected it all seemed and had a lot of fun taking silly pictures with everything. Rated average since it clearly needs some TLC, but more than worth the price of admission.
